page.title: 03Ecology and Housing
page.content: Rabbits and other animals abound, but there are very few trees, only scrub and briars. On the beach there are bits of fossils like sharks teeth and amber. There is too much rubbish from ships, visitors and fishermen. Fish that local fishermen catch are cod, mackerel, crabs, lobsters, shrimps, whiting, eels, dabs, sole, pouting, and white pout. The oldest buildings are Landguard Fort and the Martello Tower. Lots of the local housing is in terraces. They are built of Suffolk red brick. One terrace has Suffolk white bricks on the front and a tunnel through to the back. The oldest that we found were built in 1909 and 1910, but some date from the end of last century. Other houses were built more recently. The Herman de Stern,formerly a hospital is now a Community club and St Edmunds Hall belongs to the church.
